001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
004
005/**
006 * A command to do nothing but wait for a span of time.
007 * In an ideal world, you wouldn't need this. But the world is far from ideal...
008 *
009 * @author Alex Stedman
010 */
011public class WaitCommand implements Command {
012
013    /**
014     * @return the number of seconds the command will wait
015     */
016    public double getSeconds() {
017        return supplier.getAsDouble();
018    }
019
020    private DoubleSupplier supplier;
021
022    /**
023     * Create a wait command for a fixed number of seconds
024     *
025     * @param sec The number of seconds (can be non-whole numbers!)
026     */
027    public WaitCommand(double sec) {
028        supplier = () -> sec;
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * Create a wait command for a number of seconds that can be calculated when the commannd is
033     * triggered
034     *
035     * @param sup The DoublerSupplier function which calculates the number of seconds to wait
036     */
037    public WaitCommand(DoubleSupplier sup) {
038        supplier = sup;
039    }
040
041    @Override
042    public void execute() {}
043
044    @Override
045    public boolean isFinished() {
046        return supplier.getAsDouble() <= getRuntime().seconds();
047    }
048}
